trans-unit.source: These steps create a new custom [ApiController](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=512673) that sends push notifications to the app.
trans-unit.target: These steps create a new custom [ApiController](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=512673) that sends push notifications to the app.

trans-unit.source: You could implement this same code in a [TableController](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn643359.aspx) or anywhere else in your backend services.
trans-unit.target: You could implement this same code in a [TableController](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn643359.aspx) or anywhere else in your backend services.

trans-unit.source: In Visual Studio Solution Explorer, right-click the Controllers folder for the mobile service project, expand **Add**, then click **New Scaffolded Item**.
trans-unit.target: In Visual Studio Solution Explorer, right-click the Controllers folder for the mobile service project, expand **Add**, then click **New Scaffolded Item**.

trans-unit.source: This displays the Add Scaffold dialog.
trans-unit.target: This displays the Add Scaffold dialog.

trans-unit.source: Expand **Azure Mobile Services** and click **Azure Mobile Services Custom Controller**, then click **Add**, supply a **Controller name** of `NotifyAllUsersController`, then click **Add** again.
trans-unit.target: Expand **Azure Mobile Services** and click **Azure Mobile Services Custom Controller**, then click **Add**, supply a **Controller name** of `NotifyAllUsersController`, then click **Add** again.

trans-unit.source: This creates a new empty controller class named **NotifyAllUsersController**.
trans-unit.target: This creates a new empty controller class named **NotifyAllUsersController**.

trans-unit.source: In the new NotifyAllUsersController.cs project file, add the following **using** statements:
trans-unit.target: In the new NotifyAllUsersController.cs project file, add the following **using** statements:

trans-unit.source: Add the following code that implements the POST method on the controller:
trans-unit.target: Add the following code that implements the POST method on the controller:

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE]This POST method can be called by any client that has the application key, which is not secure.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE]This POST method can be called by any client that has the application key, which is not secure.

trans-unit.source: To secure the endpoint, apply the attribute `[AuthorizeLevel(AuthorizationLevel.User)]` to the method or class to require authentication.
trans-unit.target: To secure the endpoint, apply the attribute `[AuthorizeLevel(AuthorizationLevel.User)]` to the method or class to require authentication.
